description:
"I know! I'll become a monk!" Akagami Akemitsu has spent his days and nights absorbed in studying and part-time work in an effort to distance himself from his family, which is notorious as a household of philanderers. One day, he falls in love at first sight with a girl named Aoba Yuzuki, and suddenly he's constantly drowning in worldly desires. Hoping to fight back against his genes and live a more stoic life, he enters a temple... only to find out that it's a convent filled with gorgeous girls! So begins a new rom-com about the temple life of three adorable triplets and two beautiful freeloaders!

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: TenPuru -No One Can Live on Loneliness-

tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Large Breasts
tags.description: Features a character with larger-than-average breasts.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/the_red_scanner) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/古賀一臣)

Started off doing finishing work at J.C. Staff.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/magicmagico) He joined Okayasu Promotion after graduating and studied there as editor, he collected experience on tv animation and drama and gave his debut on Ninja Hattori. He is currently working for 1000 Yamakoshi. Not to be confused with the other Toshihiko Kojima whose name is written with different Kanji.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [producer](https://anilist.co/staff/152630/)._
Junichirou Suzuki is a music selector.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/aimi_sound) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aimin_official/)

A voice actor and musician, notably the lead vocalist and guitarist of [Poppin'Party](https://anilist.co/staff/153185/PoppinParty). Aimi had dreamed of becoming a singer ever since she was young. She initially only aspired to become a singer, but she became interested in voice acting after becoming familiar with the anime series Macross Frontier, where she was impressed at how the series was able to combine music and animation in its storytelling. 

In order to make her dream come true, she participated in various contests, such as the “Best of Singer Contest National Championship 2008”, which she made into the Finals but lost. She was one of 3rd ANIMAX Anison Grand Prix Finalists with Sayaka Sasaki in 2009, and was a winner of the Osaka block. On February 6th, 2010, she made it to the finals of the “Aim for Ellie! Milky Holmes Seiyuu Audition”, a seiyuu audition tour hosted by DWANGO Creative School, but lost the role to Mikoi Sasaki. However, she did make her debut as a seiyuu in the Milky Holmes anime.

Aimi was the guitarist of a girls' band in high school and self-taught, but quit playing after graduating. She picked it up back in 2014 and used it to perform during her THE iDOLM@STER Million Live! live performances as Julia. Aimi is the influence and where Kidani Takaaki, the president of Bushiroad, got his idea for the BanG Dream! franchise from - after seeing Aimi playing the guitar during THE IDOLM@STER M@STERS OF IDOL WORLD!! 2014. 

She used her full name for her voice actress career and Aimi (愛美) for her singer career, but she started to use the latter for both since December 2013.

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia)

**Non-Anime Roles**:
- Brünhilde - Azur Lane (VG)
- Mica - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Serval - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Yan - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Cristallo - Reverse: 1999 (VG)

[Website](https://yu-serizawa.com/) | [Profile (81 Produce)](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=229) | [Profile (i☆Ris)](https://iris.dive2ent.com/profile/member.php?id=1000226) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/@iRis_s_yu) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/seriko_is_no.1/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yu_Serizawa) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芹澤優)

Yuu Serizawa is a voice actress and member of the anisong and idol unit [i☆Ris](https://anilist.co/staff/131442), signed to DIVE II Entertainment, a sub-label of Avex Entertainment. She is associated with the color blue in the unit.

**Non-anime roles:**
• Nina - Memento Mori (VG)
• Bay - NIKKE: Goddess of Victory (VG)
• Nicole - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)
• Gentildonna - Uma Musume: Pretty Derby (VG)
• Asakura Karen - Heaven Burns Red (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uesaka_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/uesaka_sumire) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/uesakasumire) | [LINE Blog](https://lineblog.me/uesaka_sumire/) | [Record Label Profile](http://king-cr.jp/artist/uesakasumire/)

Sumire entered the entertainment industry at the age of 9, when she was scouted by Space Craft's junior talent division. In 2009, she landed her first regular radio gig as host of Web Raji@Dengeki Bunko, and in 2011, she transferred to animation division of Space Craft due her interest in becoming a voice actress. On March 12, 2016, Sumire received the Best Rookie Actress award in the 10th Seiyuu Awards. She has also been a member of the seiyuu unit ".lady." since 2014.

Sumire is fluent in Russian and loves the Soviet culture, which she became interested in after hearing the State Anthem of the USSR in her first year of high school. In April 2010, Sumire entered the Faculty of Foreign Studies at Sophia University, and she majored in the Russian language there.

Sumire is interested in history and war figurines, particularly Russian/Soviet history, the Showa era, and likes the book Romance of the Three Kingdoms. She also has had a strong interest in games, anime and manga ever since she was a child. Her other interests consists of photography, lolita fashion-- she works as a lolita model-- and drawing, which she is quite good at. She also loves rock and heavy metal; her favorite bands are Metallica, Judas Priest, Black Sabbath, Dragonforce, and Kinniku Shoujo Tai. Additionally, Sumire is very good friends with fellow seiyuu [Sachika Misawa](https://anilist.co/staff/102337/Sachika-Misawa), who has called Sumire "her waifu".

**Non-anime roles:**
- Rosalie - Memento Mori (VG)
- Exia - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Drake - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)

__Agency:__ 81 Produce

[Profile (81 Produce)](https://www.81produce.co.jp/dcms_plusdb/index.php/item?cell003=%E3%82%84%E8%A1%8C&label=1&cell004=&name=%E5%B1%B1%E4%B8%8B%E3%80%80%E4%B8%83%E6%B5%B7&id=326) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/773_paradise) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aishite773/)

Nanami has the least amount of experience compared to the other members, and she did not have much knowledge of anime culture. Originally she was not interested in anime, but over time she was influenced by the other members little by little.

At first, Nanami did not enjoy voice acting lessons because she was unfamiliar with anime and was not confident in her acting. As her character Hisami Nanami began to develop, she started to enjoy voice acting and began to want to work as an independent voice actress. Since vocal lessons were anime songs as well, she had to work harder since she was unfamiliar with​ the anime songs.

Her favorite voice actress is Rie Kugimiya, since her work in Toradora! was the first time that anime had made her cry. She learned many things from voice acting from Rie Kugimiya's role as Aisaka Taiga.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Yulha - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Kirara Yozakura - Blue Archive (VG)

__Place of Birth:__ Shizuoka Prefecture, Japan
__Agency:__ 81 Produce

[Profile](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=152) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/12maru17) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/maruasahina) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/madoka_maru_hina/)

Non-Anime Roles:
